title: Exploring Domestic Violence Causes in Saudi Arabia, Factor Analysis Approach
content: The objective of this research is to ascertain the elements that have an impact on and drive domestic violence in Saudi Arabia, a phenomenon that has a prevalence rate of around 35% among women globally. The researchers administered a survey to a sample of 550 individuals and using exploratory factor analysis (EFA) to analyze the collected data. The findings revealed three factors: lack of familial unity, encouragement of detrimental characteristics, and economic turmoil. The authors examined the consequences of these characteristics on preventive and intervention programs and proposed suggestions for policy makers and researchers. This research enhances the existing body of knowledge on domestic violence by doing a statistical analysis to examine the factors that lead to it and the resulting outcomes within a particular cultural setting.
